mixed-citation.named-content: Dichotomius (Luederwaldtinia) henripittieri Montoya-Molina & Vaz-De 2021, sp. nov.
mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic review of the Dichotomius (Luederwaldtinia) agenor species group (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Scarabaeinae)

tp:treatment-sec.p: urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act: CB39A85C-47A6-4EB8-B538-6D4CEED8BC63
Fig. 10 , Map 11
Diagnosis

Dichotomius henripittieri
sp. nov. differs from other species of the group by the following combination of characters: clypeal teeth short and rounded. Clypeo-genal junction not emarginate. Cephalic carina, wide as high, median tubercle rounded at apex. Dense, ocellate punctures covering interocular surface. Pronotum twice as wide as long. Anterior medial disk with weak declivity, not truncate. Impressed fine punctures restricted to antero-lateral edges. Row of uninterrupted ocellate punctures along pronotal margin. Interstriae microsculpture shagreened.
Etymology
Name based on the locality where this new species was collected, Henri Pittier National Park, Venezuela .
Material examined

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Paratypes VENEZUELA • 3 ♂♂ , 3 ♀♀ ; same collection data as for holotpye [white, p]; CEMT
.
Description
Male
MEASUREMENTS. Length: 19.36 mm .

LEGS. Metacoxa posterior edge bearing single row of disorganized ocellate setigerous punctures, separated by twice diameter of a puncture. Profemora displaying aggregation of setigerous punctures on distal ¾.
PARAMERES AND LAMELLA COPULATRIX. As in Fig. 10 E–G.
Morphological variation
Females ( Fig. 10B )
As males except for the following characters:
PRONOTUM. Surface covered by fine punctures, denser on antero-lateral areas. Punctuation on margins ocellate and dense, discernible. Hypomeron setae longer and denser than in males.
Remarks
This species was collected in the Henri Pittier National Park located on the ridge of the Cordillera de la Costa of Venezuela . The vegetation of the area is characterized by extensive cloud forest.
